Brief: 
		The class will teach techniques that will be helpful not only for those 
		who wish to trade for profit, but also for cash market participants and 
		hedgers who need to understand the market.
Understanding 
		technical analysis is the key to learning how to view the market 
		realistically and accurately so that whether your company is hedging or 
		trading, or if you're just managing your own portfolio, you can avoid 
		group think and interact successfully with the market.  Even those who 
		see the fundamentals comprehensively and clearly often err on their 
		deductions about the impact of fundamentals on price.

? Anyone wanting to be able to read and understand a 
		technical market analysis and forecast, and to develop a basic technical 
		view on their own.
		? Energy and other commodity traders seeking to understand market 
		direction and develop effective trading strategies.
		? Analysts who wish to understand the basics of technical forecasting.
		? Market participants who want to be able to identify when the market is 
		trending or correcting.
		? Planners who want to be able to determine market targets.

		A question often asked is "I have no experience with technical analysis, 
		is this class for me?" The class begins is designed for those who know 
		what a futures contract is and perhaps have some experience with the 
		cash market or hedging but no knowledge of technical analysis. 

		A typical class attendee has had some exposure to the market, usually on 
		the physical side, or as a support person, but lacks an understanding of 
		the technical. Those who do have experience with the markets but need a 
		clear understanding of how forecasting is done, will find this class 
		gives them the foundation needed to read and understand a high-level 
		technical forecast and the basics develop more accurate market view on 
		their own.







Cynthia Kase 
		- CMT, CTA - Cynthia Kase, with over 30 years industry experience, 
		is an engineer turned oil trader who, after Chevron, Chemical Bank and 
		the Saudi Oil Ministry, started Kase and Company, Inc., a trading and 
		hedging consultancy, geared towards the institutional energy sector, 
		back in 1992. As a Chartered Market Technician, and Commodity Trading 
		Advisor, she won the Market Technician Association?s ?Best of the Best? 
		award in 1997 for momentum, and is recognized by many as that market?s 
		leading forecaster, calling energy prices to within pennies with a 
		documented 96% accuracy. The author of dozens of trading articles, and 
		the acclaimed Trading with the Odds, Kase has been teaching technical 
		forecasting and analysis since 1989.
